fn.p: According to the Common Reporting Format of the UNFCCC, the source category ‘agriculture’ covers the emissions of nitrous oxide and methane. Emissions (and removals) of carbon dioxide (CO 2) from land use, land use change and forestry (LULUCF) as well as CO 2 emissions related to energy consumption at farm level (e.g. in buildings and machinery use) or to the processing of inputs (e.g. mineral fertilizers) are attributed to other sectors. In this paper, we focus only on the non-CO 2 emissions from agriculture.

This paper draws on one of the scenarios of the ‘Economic assessment of GHG mitigation policy options for EU agriculture’ (EcAMPA 1) project. For more information on the project and further scenarios, see Van Doorslaer et al. ( 2015).
